autopilot.description: Continue current task autonomously with autopilot guardrails
autopilot.template:
!`python3 "$HOME/.config/opencode/my_opencode/scripts/autopilot_command.py" $ARGUMENTS --json`
Use the runtime output as guardrails, then execute the work now from current repo context. Default completion mode is promise-based: only finish when objective is truly complete and emit `<promise>DONE</promise>`. If the run status is still running, continue iterating in this session without waiting for user input until completion gates pass or a concrete blocker is hit. Do not output another /autopilot command suggestion; perform concrete edits/checks or explain blocker with exact cause.

autopilot-go.description: One-shot start-or-resume and iterate until terminal state or cycle cap
autopilot-go.template:
!`python3 "$HOME/.config/opencode/my_opencode/scripts/autopilot_command.py" go --goal "$ARGUMENTS" --debug-command --compact --json 2>&1`
Use the runtime output as guardrails, then execute the work now from current repo context. Default completion mode is promise-based: only finish when objective is truly complete and emit `<promise>DONE</promise>`. If the run status is still running, continue iterating in this session without waiting for user input until completion gates pass or a concrete blocker is hit. Do not output another /autopilot command suggestion; perform concrete edits/checks or explain blocker with exact cause.

autopilot-go-verbose.description: Run /autopilot go with full verbose runtime payload
autopilot-go-verbose.template:
!`python3 "$HOME/.config/opencode/my_opencode/scripts/autopilot_command.py" go $ARGUMENTS --debug-command --json 2>&1`
Use the runtime output as guardrails, then execute the work now from current repo context.

autopilot-objective.template:
!`python3 "$HOME/.config/opencode/my_opencode/scripts/autopilot_command.py" go --completion-mode objective $ARGUMENTS --debug-command --compact --json 2>&1`
Use objective done-criteria gates to complete the run. Execute concrete work from current repo context and continue until objective gates pass or a concrete blocker is hit.

continue-work.description: Continue current request with inferred autopilot objective and immediate execution
continue-work.template:
!`python3 "$HOME/.config/opencode/my_opencode/scripts/autopilot_command.py" go --goal "$ARGUMENTS" --debug-command --compact --json 2>&1`
Use the runtime output as guardrails, then execute the work now from current repo context. Default completion mode is promise-based: only finish when objective is truly complete and emit `<promise>DONE</promise>`. If the run status is still running, continue iterating in this session without waiting for user input until completion gates pass or a concrete blocker is hit. Do not output another /autopilot command suggestion; perform concrete edits/checks or explain blocker with exact cause.
